org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers

Class LimitsHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.cdap.http.AbstractHttpHandler
      • org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers.AbstractRestDbHandler
        • org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers.LimitsHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.cdap.http.HttpHandler

    @Path(value="/v2/limits/")
public class LimitsHandler
extends AbstractRestDbHandler
    This is the AbstractRestDbHandler handling all requests made on the bandwidth limits REST entry point.

    • Method Detail

      • getLimits

        @GET
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void getLimits(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                          io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder)
        Method called to obtain a description of the host's current bandwidth limits.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request

      • initializeLimits

        @POST
@Consumes(value="application/json")
public void initializeLimits(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                                  io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder)
        Method called to initiate the entry for this host in the bandwidth limits database. If the host already has limits set in its configuration, they will be replaced by these new ones.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request

      • updateLimits

        @PUT
@Consumes(value="application/json")
public void updateLimits(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                             io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder)
        Method called to update this host's bandwidth limits in the database and configuration.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request

      • deleteLimits

        @DELETE
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void deleteLimits(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                                io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder)
        Method called to remove any bandwidth limits in place on this host. Also removes any limits set in the configuration.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request

      • options

        @OPTIONS
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void options(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                            io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder)
        Method called to get a list of all allowed HTTP methods on this entry point. The HTTP methods are sent as an array in the reply's headers.
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made on the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
